{"id":707552886,"lang":"python3","time":"1 month, 1 week","timestamp":1653559426,"status_display":"Runtime Error","runtime":"N/A","url":"/submissions/detail/707552886/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Median of Two Sorted Arrays","memory":"N/A","code":"class Solution:\n    can = []\n    def search(self, a, b, flag):\n        n = len(a)\n        m = len(b)\n        l1 = 0\n        r1 = n - 1\n        while l1 <= r1:\n            m1 = (l1 + r1) // 2\n            no_lower = m1\n            no_upper = n - 1 - m1\n            l2 = 0\n            r2 = m - 1\n            i2 = -1\n            while (l2 <= r2):\n                m2 = (l2 + r2) // 2\n                if b[m2] >= a[m1]:\n                    i2 = m2\n                    r2 = m2 - 1\n                else:\n                    l2 = m2 + 1\n            if i2 == -1:\n                no_lower += m2\n            else:\n                no_lower += i2\n                no_upper += m - i2\n            if ((n + m) % 2 == 1) and (no_lower == no_upper):\n                print('candidate even ', flag, m1)\n                self.can.append(a[m1])\n            if ((n + m) % 2 == 0) and abs(no_lower - no_upper) <= 1:\n                print('candidate odd ', flag, m1)\n                self.can.append(a[m1])\n            if no_lower < no_upper:\n                l1 = m1 + 1\n            else:\n                r1 = m1 - 1\n            \n    def findMedianSortedArrays(self, nums1: List[int], nums2: List[int]) -> float:\n        self.can = []\n        self.search(nums1, nums2, 'a')\n        print('------------')\n        self.search(nums2, nums1, 'b')\n        if len(self.can) == 1:\n            return self.can[0]\n        else:\n            return (self.can[0] + self.can[1]) / 2.0\n        \n        ","compare_result":"","title_slug":"median-of-two-sorted-arrays"}
